snippet: Once teetering on the edge of bankruptcy, the Republican National Committee has accumulated large cash reserves that could give Mitt Romney a critical boost.
abstract: Republican National Committee has raised more than $110 million over the past 15 months and retired more than half its debt, accumulating large cash reserves that could give Mitt Romney a critical boost as he intensifies his campaign against Pres Obama; the committee, once teetering on the edge of bankruptcy and irrelevance, reported more money in the bank at the start of last month than the Democratic National Committee, which raised about $137 million during the same period but also spent far more.
lead_paragraph: Once teetering on the edge of bankruptcy, the Republican National Committee has accumulated large cash reserves that could give Mitt Romney a critical boost.

headline.seo: Republican Committee Fund-Raising Has Big Turnaround
headline.main: Republican Committee Makes Big Turnaround on Fund-Raising
headline.print_headline: Big Turnaround On Fund-Raising For G.O.P. Panel
